column4: ~help~ :  I just reinstalled everything on this SATA, and im having a major partition crisis. My data partition (seperate from system) is 170 gigs. 110 gigs are in use... and 6 gigs are free? Thats not all. Gparted and parted in general freeze on startup. And what is this:::  Invalid argument while trying to resize /dev/sda1
So what, no one can help me?
uh oh... hold on, it didnt want to mount back on
it was ext3, i removed the journal to try to resize it, but that didnt work either..... fstab must not work.
fstab has nothing to do with an unmounted filesystem, sounds like you have filesystem errors
i might add now that while resizing the partition on the live cd before i started all this, i thought it locked up and canceled the process c.c
then it's probably completely trashed, delete it and create a new one
yeah, that'll be easy with 120 gigs of files
don't know what to tell you, filesystem resizing is one of those things you CANNOT have interrupted, it's trashed
I never do partition operations without backups :/
I have backups. Anyway the files are accessable.
its just annoying. Backups... i mean, we're talking about gigs and gigs.
Well thanks... i may have a cheat for this anyway
I have little sympathy for all the people who don't want to backup their 100s of gigs of pirated media before doing destructive operations.... anyway your first stop should be a fsck
Actually its largely po..... yeah, aquired media. I tried fsck... meh, ill just use the other partition since xp wasnt installing anyway
